description: Essentially parallel series-parallel networks with n labeled edges, multiple edges not allowed.
references: J. W. Moon, Some enumerative results on series-parallel networks, Annals Discrete Math., 33 (1987), 199-226 (the sequence Q_n).
links: Index entries for sequences mentioned in Moon (1987)
formula: E.g.f. satisfies A(x) = x + O(x^2), 2*A(x) = exp(A(x)) - 1 + log(1+x).a(n) = sum(m=1..n, (sum(k=0..m-1, (m+k-1)!*sum(j=0..k, sum(i=0..j, ((-1)^i*2^i*stirling2(m+j-i-1,j-i))/(i!*(m+j-i-1)!))/(k-j)!))) *stirling1(n,m)). [From Vladimir Kruchinin, Feb 17 2012]E.g.f.: -1/2 + log(1+x)/2 - LambertW(-exp(-1/2)*sqrt(1+x)/2). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 08 2014a(n) ~ n^(n-1) / (2*sqrt(2) * (4-exp(1))^(n-1/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 08 2014
example: A(x) = x + 1/2*x^3 + 7/24*x^4 + 3/4*x^5 + 169/180*x^6 + ...For n=4 there are two unlabeled networks:..o.....o--o./.\.../....\o...o o------o.\./..owhich can be labeled in 3 (resp. 4) ways, for a total of 7.
maple: Q := x; for d from 1 to 30 do Q := Q+c*x^(d+1)/(d+1)!; t1 := coeff(series(2*Q - (exp(Q)-1+log(1+x)), x, d+2), x, d+1); t2 := solve(t1,c); Q := subs(c=t2,Q); Q := series(Q,x,d+2); od: A058379 := n->coeff(Q,x,n)*n!; # method 1Order := 50; t1 := solve(series((exp(A)-2*A-1),A)=-log(1+x),A); A058379 := n-> n!*coeff(t1,x,n); # method 2
mathematica: CoefficientList[InverseSeries[Series[-1+E^(1+2*a-E^a), {a, 0, 20}], x], x]*Range[0, 20]! (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jul 21 2011 *)CoefficientList[Series[(-1 + Log[1+x] - 2*ProductLog[-Sqrt[1+x]/(2*Sqrt[E])])/2,{x,0,15}],x] * Range[0,15]! (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 08 2014 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A058380, A058381. See A000669 for unlabeled case when parallel edges are allowed.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 19 2000
